title: Fix Frog Profile header Back button placement, behavior, and styling

requirements.summary: Add/restore a Reddit-style Back button in the Frog Profile header row and place it to the left of the avatar without overlap.
acceptanceCriteria: The Frog Profile page shows a Back button in the profile header area.
The Back button is horizontally placed to the left of the avatar (same row) with consistent spacing (i.e., not stacked on top of the avatar).
At common viewport sizes (mobile and desktop), the Back button does not overlap the avatar, username, or counts; the layout remains stable and readable.

file_operations.description: Update the profile header layout to include a Back button placed as the leftmost element in the header row (left of the Avatar) using a stable flex layout (e.g., button + avatar + content with appropriate gap/flex-shrink/min-w-0) so the button never overlaps the avatar or header content across mobile/desktop widths.

requirements.summary: Implement Frog Profile Back button navigation using browser history with a home-route fallback and accessible interaction.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking Back navigates to the previous page when `window.history.length > 1`.
If there is no meaningful browser history entry, the Back button falls back to navigating to the home route (`/`).
The Back button is keyboard accessible and has an accessible label (e.g., visible “Back” text and/or sr-only label).

file_operations.description: Add Back button click handling to prefer `window.history.back()` when `window.history.length > 1`, otherwise navigate to `/` via TanStack Router; ensure the control is a semantic <button> with visible "Back" text (and/or aria-label) for keyboard and screen-reader accessibility.

requirements.summary: Match Frog Profile Back button styling to the existing Lily page Back button (icon + label, muted/hover, rounded hit area) in English.
acceptanceCriteria: The Frog Profile Back button uses an arrow-left icon and the label text “Back”.
Default styling is muted and changes on hover similarly to the Lily page Back button.
No new non-English user-facing strings are introduced as part of this change.

file_operations.description: Implement the Back button UI to mirror the LilyPage Back button styling: include the ArrowLeft icon from lucide-react, the English label "Back", muted foreground with hover-to-foreground, hover background, and rounded hit area consistent with LilyPage.
